Reviews.Title: “Dee”
Reviews.Author: dee0072000
Reviews.Content: In a good location near Hollywood boulevard and walk of fame. Hotel was fine it had free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: tjaustralia
Reviews.Content: I traveled with 2 others after a long flight from Australia checked in at 9am earlier then allowed and the desk staff were friendly and allowed us to check in our room. They organized our day tour for the following day including pick up and even sent a staff member to our room to collect our money and bring our documents. Rooms are basic but cosy. Location is great within walking distance of shops and Hollywood. Breakfast basic but nice. Staff very friendly. Would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “A good location. Poor management.”
Reviews.Author: GegeMei
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, 3-5 minute walking distance the Hollywood Boulevard. It is a safe hotel in fair condition. However, the old tv with the broken remote, cheap kid-size towels, $10 per day for parking, and poor wi-fi was enough to score it below average. The property is not in bad condition but could be better with better management. Also, many young adults stayed here and did not let other guests sleep wit their loud music and partying until after 2am. Yes, and management did nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Eeeew! Never again.”
Reviews.Author: IRMTBR
Reviews.Content: While I like luxury, I am perfectly happy with a good, clean room with basic ammenities. This ain't it folks. The carpet is grimy and there was something smearing on the bathroom wall. We usually visit the Hollywood Bowl once a year, and stay in a near by hotel and walk to and from the Bowl. Our usual hotel across the street (same price) was booked, so I opted for this one. Beside needing a steam cleaning, the road noise was deafening and Mom and Dad - yes there is a pool, but it's about 12'x12' in full view of the elevator, completely shadowed in - just enough pool that they can list the hotel as having one. Don't believe it - move along to a cleaner, better value across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good location if you don't have a car”
Reviews.Author: susykat
Reviews.Content: I recently made a quick and unplanned trip to Los Angeles. I chose this hotel based on location and price. I was traveling solo without a car, and needed to be near a metro stop because I had to get to downtown the next morning. While this isn't my favorite area of LA (Santa Monica is), I am familiar and comfortable with it and preferred to stay here rather than downtown. I read reviews before I showed up and have to say that I had no problems with the hotel at all. I stayed in a King room, which was quite large, and more importantly, clean. Fancy and modern it was not, but I didn't expect that, and don't require it. I will agree with the other reviews that the room was quite dark, but I don't see this as a problem unless you're planning on reading alot in the room. The bed was super comfy and I didn't want to get up in the morning. The room price included breakfast, which was adequate for my needs as well. Nothing fancy: juice, coffee, donuts, bagels, and you can make waffles. I put too much batter in the pan and made a mess--the girl who was working there was very nice about it :) I will also add that the front desk staff were also very pleasant. I didn't use the pool. It is very small and clearly is not meant for swimming but rather for taking a dip if you're hot, which I was tempted to do because the temperature when I was there was 100F! Now, if I had a car and had to pay to park, I would be unhappy about that, BUT if you don't have a car, the location is very good. It is a couple of blocks from the Hollywood Walk of Fame and Grumann's Theatre and all the kookiness of Hollywood Boulevard, which you will want to at least see and say you did it. There is also a Metro Stop right on Hollywood and Highland (Red Line) which will take you to Universal and Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE - I REPEAT DO NOT”
Reviews.Author: missliss9
Reviews.Content: No one should stay at this hotel unless you enjoy a WAY less than sufficient room and being treated like nothing by a manager who doesn't give a lick about his customers. This hotel charges you to park (even though the property offers free parking) then goes ahead and rents spots for $20 to Hollywood Bowl concert goers and DOES NOT save stalls for paying patrons! Would you like to park on the sidewalk? If you try and complain to the manager, you might get kicked out for simply trying to get some good service!! That's right folks, this place is not for you!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: Ruttert
Reviews.Content: We were forced to leave by manager frank. We complained because they charge guests for parking and then without reserving space for guests who have paid they sell parking for concerts near by. After we complained frank told us "since we won't beable to make you happy u can leave now and we won't charge for the night or tomorrow (we had 2 more nights)! We told him that's no way to run a business and then he told us we had 30 minutes to leave or he would call police because we were being "belligerent"....thanks frank! Across the street from this place is best western. Prices are about the same but western has nice staff, nicer rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Californiagirl1964
Reviews.Content: Thought this hotel would be good because of the name. It was overpriced, the rooms were very dark, not enough light to put makeup on even in the day. The bathroom sink, was by the bed, not in bathroom. Bathroom had an old mildew smell, rugs worn out. Just looked old and not taken care of. The pool was so little, never went in, real little and in alley by elevator outside. Breakfast room was very small, just had coffee, juice, bagels, waffles, no eggs or bacon. Was overpriced for this place and had to pay $20 to park everyday, some nights, you would get to garage there and it was full, had to double park behind another car. Never again!!!!!!! Worst place I ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Location”
Reviews.Author: holidayers007
Reviews.Content: Ok so what do you expect for a cheap hotel within walking distance to the strip. Staff was friendly and helpful. No hesitation was given upon asking to inspect the room prior ti check-in. The room was clean and spacious. We had a smoking room which was towards the back so we had no problem with noise. The pool area was nothing spectacular and was just that a pool with a fence around it but who comes to Hollywood to sit by the pool. Sight seeing is what it's all about and this hotel was about 10 minutes walking distance to the strip. We didn't get to experience the free breakfast as the street had an unexpected power cut nothing the hotel could have done about it. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Secure.”
Reviews.Author: tideswestsavannah
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in July 2011 while on business. I also wanted to fit in some fun activities and this hotel is centrally located to sights in Hollywood and beyond. The staff was very friendly and helpful with restaurant suggestions. The rooms and hallway look to be newly renovated. I felt very safe as a female travelling alone and would stay here again on future visits. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but staff has an attitude”
Reviews.Author: zobo9511
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed here for a concert at the Hollywood Bowl. The rooms are a bit small and some of the room numbers are missing or typed really small on a minuscule piece of paper taped to the wall. We didnt have any bug problems, but our toilet backed up. My mom called the front desk and told them our toilet was plugged. The guy says he'll bring us a plunger. WHAT?! My mom tells the guy we have four people in the room and the guy responds saying he is not a maitenence guy. The rooms are broken the beds are hard the tv is so outdated, the pool is absolutely pathetic. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but dark wallpapers and hostess :-)"”
Reviews.Author: Lesa2011
Reviews.Content: Good location in Hollywood. Near Sunset blv. But inside the hotel you can see dark wallpapers in the room and the corridor. So, nice place, but they should change the walls. And the stuff was friendly only first day. Then the good mood vanish after night! )))

Reviews.Title: “I'm staying somewhere else next time!”
Reviews.Author: Zvycake
Reviews.Content: First time staying at this Comfort Inn and it will be the last. The only good thing was that it was a short walk to the Hollywood Bowl. There were no parking spaces left so the attendant told me to park along the side wall perpendicular to the other cars. When I went to check out, they said my card was charged $8 for a parking fee! The lady ahead of me got charged $25 for parking two cars! No one told us about the charge initially! Anyway, the hallways felt dingy and dark. My window was open all night-it wouldn't shut! Lucky I was on the second floor, who knows who could have easily climbed in a ground window?! The room was pretty bare, a chunk was missing off the nightstand table, the plugs had no outlet covers and many of the lamps were unplugged when I arrived in the room. The upside of the room was a microwave, mini fridge and clean sheets and fluffy pillows. I didn't feel that this hotel was maintained as well as it could be and it wasn't worth the price of a night there. Do your homework if you're planning on staying in Hollywood and avoid this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, nice rooms, not so nice operators.”
Reviews.Author: atao7210
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at our hotel, the staff told us that our hotel reservation has been cancelled by phone, despite the fact that none of us cancelled our booking, and even if we did, we would have done it via email. Our confirmation letter clearly stated 'RESERVATIONS CANT BE CANCELLED', and so the man decided to do us a 'favour' by giving us a room at a MUCH higher than agreed price than what we have booked previously over 2 months ago. I would not ever stay at this hotel ever again, we are still in dispute over the money that they owe us. This also happened to another group of guests when we were leaving, teh owner told them that they apparently did not pay 'tax' and needed to pay another surcharge. Definately would not recommend going to this hotel. AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting customer service”
Reviews.Author: williamv01
Reviews.Content: 1. AT CHECK IN, I WAS TOLD MY BOOKING WAS CANCELLED AND THEN MY CREDIT CARD WAS DELIBERATELY OVERCHARGED When I arrived at the hotel, I was told that my booking, which I had prepaid via the Choice Hotels website almost 3 months in advance, had been cancelled. The staff member insisted that I or one of my family member's had cancelled it. He checked us in at a rate that was more expensive than what I had booked online and he insisted that it was a good deal. The manager also said that we had been given a good deal and I insisted that the difference in rates be refunded. He said he would "fix it up" and at check out he said it had been corrected. It still has not been corrected. I contacted the hotel and the company's head office via email on at least 4 occasions over the last month to have this problem resolved and I have either been ignored or lied, more than once. They either did not reply or replied and said that they would respond within 7 to 10 days, which of course they never did. 2. I OVERHEARD ANOTHER COUPLE COMPLAINING ABOUT BEING OVERCHARGED WHILE WE WERE CHECKING OUT The other couple had pre-booked their stay on the company's website as I had done. They were told by the manager that they had to pay tax in addition to what they had already paid, even though their booking confirmation said that taxes had been included. The manager couldn't care less and told them to ring head office. 3. THEY REFUSED TO TRANSFER A PHONE CALL FOR ME TO MY ROOM A family member phoned the hotel and asked to speak to me and the rude staff member said "no" and hung up.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: Steven199
Reviews.Content: When my family travels, we always stay at a comfort inn. The location is great, right next to the Walk Of Fame. However the hotel and management are horrible, we stayed in a suite that had a couch for an extra person but with no pillows or blankets; We called the front desk and asked them for a extra blanket, they said they didn't have any. What hotel doesn't provide blankets? They advertise a room for 6 people but only the 2 queens have blankets. Check in time is at 2:00pm, we waited and waited in till 4:30 to check in. They could have told us at the beginning it was going to be 2 hours, not 10 minutes. And don't get me started on the manager, he is rude, read every review on here. He barley speaks english, and he doesn't even know what customer service is. There are many hotels in the neighborhood, don't stay here. They charge you 8 dollars a night to park. And if you brought two cars like me, they charge you 25 for the other car as well. Again don't stay here. Try a different hotel. Oh i almost forgot, the hotel inside needs major remodeling, everything looks and feels dirty. Rooms smell, things don't work, not worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty & Rude Manager”
Reviews.Author: b_goofy1
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review before but I felt compelled to do this because of the rudeness of the manager who works there... he did not say his name. I wish I asked so I can write it on this review. First off, my kids did not like the smell at all. I figured we got what we paid for but when I was charged 2x for one night. I called them up and asked why I was charged for two times for one night when I went through http://Hotels.com the first night and the second night which I now regret was through them. They claimed that I had two rooms! The guy called me a liar ... he was not only rude by hanging up on me the first time but the second time he called me a liar. I asked him what kind of customer service is this? He said, "We don't have customer service we just rent room." I then hung up on him ... what a jerk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christy823
Reviews.Content: My Mom and I stayed here over the weekend of Oct. 9-13, 2010 and were very pleased with our stay. The location was great. The room was nice. Parking wasn't a problem, and the staff was pleasant. When we go back to LA/Hollywood we will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very dirty room, unsafe conditions”
Reviews.Author: AZSunshineTravels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to California for vacation, and booked this hotel because of its proximity to attractions in Hollywood for the two nights of our trip. When we checked into the room, it was very dirty. There was even dried throw-up on the wall, the bedspread and bed skirt. We called the front desk to see about a different room, and they said there was not one available. They offered no remedy to our situation. We suggested they clean and replace the linens, but they indicated that they had no extra bed skirts or bedspreads, but could remove them from the room. As it was very late and we were exhausted, we decided this would have to suffice. We tried to not let this ruin our time, and the next day spent as little time at the hotel as possible. Upon arriving back for our second and last night in the hotel, we were alarmed when the door handle broke off from the inside. We could not leave the room, we were locked in. We called the front desk and the night manager/repairman opened the door and began yelling at us for breaking the door handle. Mind you, we did not do anything to "break" the handle, it was cheap, like pretty much everything else at this hotel, and fell apart. The night manager then showed us how we could place the handle back in where it should go, and tilt it just so....and twist it just so.....and press it this way and that way, about a 5 minute process, then we could exit the room. We explained to him that we did not feel this was safe, especially in the event of a fire. He replied that we should not have broken it then! We were so disgusted, we left and decided to go on to our next destination a night early. This hotel is a joke, their night staff is very rude. I would not recommend this hotel to an enemy, no one deserves this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to stay with young children in Hollywood....”
Reviews.Author: tattooedtraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week with our kids, and we couldnt have been happier. The location was so central to everything in and around Los Angeles, and one of the biggest perks was, on certain nights...we just left the car in the garage, at the hotel and walked to Hollywood Blvd. The rooms were renovated and clean....the beds were cozy and slept us all well. The free breakfast in the lobby, is a major time and money saver for big families as ours. The Pool was kinda small, but then again, you dont go to LA for a pool, when the Pacific Ocean is only 12 miles away. I must admit, a few days before we left for LA, i got to reading some of the negative reviews on this hotel, and started stressing "what am I getting into"...between reading about bedbugs and parking issues...i checked in stressed and ready to battle...but all my fears were eliminated as soon as we got into the room....no issues of any kind...with cleanliness or anything else....only one time did we come back late around 1230am to find no parking available...but the hotel guarantees for every room there is one assigned parking spot....so once i told the front desk we couldnt find a spot...he right away moved a car out of a spot for us to park...issue resolved....we couldnt have been happier with this hotel, and recommend those with children and on a budget, to seriously give this place a try, dont be put off by any bad reviews you see here....its all good...we will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but dirty”
Reviews.Author: corneliamarie
Reviews.Content: The reception staff at this hotel are rude and abrupt. I found a smear of blood in the sheets and several hairs and asked for a change of sheets. They changed them but left me to do the pillow cases myself. Ice machine was not working tv remote was not working. Carpet filthy. Room was quite large and had air con and a writing desk. Close enough to walk to Hollywood Blvd but other than that I would not recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location is good, but at what price?”
Reviews.Author: sweetiestace16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all about location. It’s about a 5 minute walk from a major mall and just a little farther to the Hollywood Walk of Fame, 2 wax museums, etc. It’s also just down the street from Universal Studios. It's clean enough and the concierge was helpful. However, everything about the hotel is faded and worn, from the thin towels to the building itself. The free breakfast is minimal - doughnuts/bagels/toast and coffee, some juice and boxed cereals. Parking for the hotel is $8/day. The walls are very thin, so you better pray your neighbors are considerate- or bring earplugs. There is a tiny little swimming pool outside, no hot tub. If you are planning on spending minimal time in the hotel and most of your time on the streets, it would probably suffice. It's not exactly "comfortable" but it will do.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been booked in - couldn't stay there”
Reviews.Author: HeatherAuckland
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel at dinner time and went up to our room. The lift and corridor were dirty with debris. The room was dark and dusty. When we pulled back the beds discovered that the linen had not been changed. There was no way we were going to stay at this hotel so checked out. Unable to obtain a refund for the following two days we were booked in because apparently the hotel didn't have a chance to rectify our concerns. We would have thought the room should have been ready for our arrival not requiring us to make sure it was!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: SunRunner
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for it's proximity to the Hollywood Bowl. Typically, Comfort Inns are clean and comfortable. The room I had was NOT. It was large, but dirty. The carpet was dusty/dirty outside of the obvious traffic path, the bedspread and blanket were so gross with stains and were so old, I was surprised they were in use. I pulled them down and made do with the sheet, which I "think" was clean. The towels were old and dingy, the bathroom had black mold in the shower. Lights were very, very low wattage, TV was quite old but did work. The staff wasn't pleasant... I tried to check in early, but was directed to "read the sign!" which stated no check in before 2 pm. Okay, that's fine, but whatever happened to being nice/friendly about it?? Geez. I had the whole "squick" factor the both nights and if I could have found another nearby hotel, I'd have never checked in, based on the attitude earlier and after seeing the room, I looked for another hotel much harder. Given it was the Eagles concert, everything was hugely overpriced or booked. He did ask me how long ago I'd booked the room to get the low rate... all and all, just not a pleasant experience. I guess customer service really is a lost art. Too bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Conveniently Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mocccc
Reviews.Content: We had a good 3 days here from UK first time in LA We found the manager welcoming and friendly in fact lent me his laptop to send emails home Kids liked the location great to be walking distance from Hollywood walk of Fame. We visited Universal and took the tour around homes of the stars. Basic no frills hotel there is a tiny pool if you want to cool off. Mike

Reviews.Title: “I got what I paid for!”
Reviews.Author: DJTOBY
Reviews.Content: Once checked into the room, I enjoyed my stay at this location. It was within a 10-15 minute walk from Hollywood Bld. to see the 'Stars' on the Walk of fame, visit the Hollywood & Highland Mall and to visit the 'Madame Tussauds' wax museum (highly recomended). The bed had an average mattress that felt to be around 10 years old. My problems were the frendliness of the personel at the front desk. They don't seem like people persons at all! No customer service skills at all. No greeting, no smile....in fact, they make you feel somewhat uncomfortable while you're checking in. The next problem was with the parking. I got there around 2pm while there was ample parking available. I then left around 7pm to see Hollywood at night. When I arrived at 11:30, there was no parking available!!!! The night staff had vehicles parking in handicapped spots, against the walls of the parking garage blocking access doors and also in front of the hotel lobby areas. They asked me to squeeze into a very tight 'compact car' parking space. After not having adaquit parking you would think the least they would do is assist you in parking to make sure you don't hit other vehicles.....they didn't even do that!!!! On the good side, the breakfast was simple and good. The showers were clean as well. Also the rooms were quiet.

Reviews.Title: “RACIST OR IGNORENT, maybe BOTH!”
Reviews.Author: LisaRiley
Reviews.Content: My husband is an African American man, and was treated HORRIBLE by the manager(he was a middle aged Indian or middle eastern man) when we first arrived he said there were no rooms available, then a white couple came in and he sold them a room RIGHT IN FRONT OF US, we felt very disrespected. We were in the lobby looking for a different place to go stay(because no rooms were available) about 20 minutes after he sold the room to us he said he found us a room and then he said there was no smoking rooms, which is a LIE. We stayed there for 3 days and HATED IT. the man was so rude and very racist or ignorant, honestly i couldn't tell but i know he had a problem with my husband because of the color of his skin. Like the others said the breakfast is a JOKE, and the building was falling apart, it defiantly wasn't worth 160 bucks a night. lucky for them we stayed since everywhere else was booked. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Choose this place for value and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: never_again01
Reviews.Content: First mistake, Hollywood on Halloween weekend! Now the good stuff. Very clean. Friendly staff. low noise factor. Would choose this place over Highland gardens, Magic Castle Hotel or any other of the Boutique hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good room for the price, great location.”
Reviews.Author: lisa0015
Reviews.Content: As an extremely frequent business traveler, I'd say the room itself was maybe average. It was a large room, and was obviously newly remodeled. The room was clean and comfortable. I tend not to spend a lot of time in the hotel room, so all I look for is a clean and comfortable bed and a clean bathroom, and this hotel met my expectations. I did not try the breakfast or use the pool (the pool was extremely small, so if you're looking for a resort type pool, you won't find it here). The parking was convenient and cheap, considering the city location. You can hear the typical city noise (traffic, etc), but it wasn't that bad and had no problem sleeping. The one thing that this hotel does offer is great location. It is within walking distance to all the tourist venues of Hollywood Blvd, and if you want to venture out of Hollywood, the freeway is extremely convenient to the hotel. If you're looking for great value, great location and don't need anything other than the basic ammenities, then I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not what expected”
Reviews.Author: dalcrazy
Reviews.Content: The male managers that worked the evenings were very kind, friendly, and helpful. All others, just doing their job. The suite was large, clean and comfortable, but it was missing a remote control, the fridge rattled all night long, and there were no black out curtains . . . there were trendy wide wooden horizontal blinds that allowed night light to flood into the room. It looked nice, but it didn't keep the room dark enough for good sleeping. The pool is tiny - maybe 10' x 14' and only 3 1/2' deep, and a bit dirty. The breakfast room was a joke! Only 5 tables and 10 chairs. You were standing next to and bending over people to get to the food. It was very uncomfortable. The food was the same every day and very sugary items . . . cold cereal, donuts, bagels, waffles, and apples, oranges. It was not pleasant eating in that area cramped with people.

Reviews.Title: “3 years in a row - still good!”
Reviews.Author: JousterWife
Reviews.Content: For the 3rd year in a row, I booked the Comfort Suites the same time for the same purpose. We've stayed in a suite the last three years, so maybe that's why I've never had a complaint. Now, we're booking this year for the same masqurade ball we've attended the last three summers and have no doubt that it'll suit our needs. There are 5-6 of us and we always book the suite. It fits, it's nice, it's clean, it had room for all our costumes. The gentleman that worked downstairs at the counter was SO NICE and so helpful. I will write a review after we travel this summer to see if anything changes.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute nightmare”
Reviews.Author: mikester92117
Reviews.Content: I visit Hollywood about once a month for business. I travel by train and metro from San Diego, so I'm car-less and location is very important. I have always stayed at the Best Western across the street. While that is nothing special, it is so much better than this place. The place looks nice from the street but it's merely a facade. Once you get into the property you will see the place is really in major disrepair. The pool is unsightly and I wouldn't even think about going in. It's not very larger either. I took the elevator to the 2nd floor where my room is and once in the hallway, you can plainly see the carpet is old and not even tacked down at the walls and so looks terrible. When I reached my room I noticed the door was open. It doesn't spring closed like most hotels, so you have to manually close the door. I found out the deadbolt didn't work at all. So much for security. The room had an ethernet port in the wall. Except there was no signal at all - zero, i.e., non-functional. The wi-fi from the lobby 30 feet away was too weak to connect. I actually was able to weakly connect with the Best Western across the street as I stayed there a few weeks ago and the log-in credentials still worked. The room had an odor to it. The street noise was very loud. The blinds were missing a couple of slats which let street light into the room. I didn't see any bugs like other reviewers have mentioned. But the room just didn't feel that clean. The bed was okay. The phone in the room was full of static, not that I planned to use it, but I tried calling the lobby and wasn't able to reach anyone. While there were 3 phones in the room, they all had very loud static sound. The desk didn't have a desk chair. Anyway, avoid this place. It's just a horrible hotel. The only thing positive I can say is I made it out of there alive.

Reviews.Title: “Women Beware!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beware451
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this location for 2 days with my young daughter. My first bad encounter with the manager during a phone conversation the day of my arrival as he demanded check-in time was at 2pm regardless if rooms were available, (I was told when booking I could check-in as soon as my room type was available since I flew into town early 9am.) Manager eventually allowed us to have a room at 12:30pm. Bad smell in hotel even worse in my non smoking room. Room had an odor of old cigars and mold. My daughter and I had to meet up with friends immediately after checking in so I opened window and turned air conditioning on to attempt to rid room of foul smell. We returned after midnight to find smell to be no better. Morning came around and I called front desk for towels (only given 2) manager stated they had no towels as laundry had not been done (hotel was not sold out and manager refused to go to another room to get any towels). To top that off there was no hot water. PAY ATTENTION LADIES as this is very IMPORTANT, LOCK and LATCH YOUR DOOR!!!!!! I had the water running attempting to get some hot water in the shower as I was walking to the bathroom I noticed that the door handle to my room was slowly moving so I immediately stopped in my tracks. I witnessed my door slowly and quietly opening until it could not move any further due to the latch being engaged. The door then began closing slowly until it silently pulled to. I quietly moved to the door looking through the peephole attempting to see who was in the hallway. I could not see anything so I opened the door to find a male employee wandering around the hallway. This creepy person was at the front desk at the time of my arrival. This man did not work at the front desk as he informed me when I tried to check in that he was just watching over the desk and that I had to wait for another employee to help me. This employee was not housekeeping nor was there a housekeeper anywhere around. So why the HELL was he trying to enter my room? He was very aware that I was traveling alone with my young daughter. I immediately woke my daughter and told her we had to pack and get out of this hotel. I then phoned the manager which was very RUDE, UNCONCERNED, and UNWILLING to help!!!! The manager asked me why I was calling him and bothering him with my concerns. He even went as far to tell me to call corporate to make a complaint. I find this behavior from a manager appalling! I work for a major airline and travel all over the world and trust me I have had my share of bad hotels but I have never found myself so afraid or furious than my stay at this hotel! STAY AWAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: danaxxx99
Reviews.Content: DON"T waste your money..... seriously. This place is the ultimate dive. Pictures looked good but it stunk like mold and there were stains all over the carpets. The hallway wasn't any better. At the end of the hall there was plastic hiding something. The parking garage was full of garbage and unused furniture. Had homeless people trying to get into unlocked vehicles. Location was great but you woud be better off staying at the Motel 6 on Whitley. There you don't need to worry about your vehicle and it doesn't stink. Don't recommend this to anyone, evenif you are on a tight budget, stay somewhere else. Chexk in staff was rude and not helpful but check out staff were much more polite. I guess they were happy to get our money!

Reviews.Title: “Location + Value = A little 'ick'”
Reviews.Author: Carrie R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Comfort Inn on Highland in Hollywood for one night in January of 2009. We contacted the hotel directly and we were given a rate of $69 per night, on a Sunday night during MLK weekend. The good - this hotel is in a great walking location to Hollywood Blvd. It isn't really my scene, but we had a great dinner at a (chain) italian restaurant. I made the most of it and had a great time watching a few street performers and having too many drinks. The hotel was OK - it was nothing special but I didn't feel unsafe. The beds were comfortable (after checking for bedbugs we read about on Trip Advisor - we found nothing of concern after scouring the mattress for evidence). Surprisingly, the shower head was great! My mom said that the breakfast looked decent, although we had other b-fast plans away from the hotel. The Bad - Our room was located looking over Highland - which was noisy from 10 PM to 10 AM! (I'm a city dweller and used to traffic noise) I'd recommend asking for a room further from the street. The hotel was showing it's age - a slat missing from the window coverings, a dirty chair in the corner (find a steam cleaner already!), worn towels, carpeting, and broken plastic on the light switch fixture. It wasn't scary dirty, but it didn't feel particularly clean either. The Ugly - I overlooked most of the rooms misgivings, for the value and location, but I'd probably not recommend it. My main disappointment? That I don't have any photos to share - don't trust the Expedia photos - they're not representative! If you stay here, make sure you're getting one heck of a deal!

Reviews.Title: “Decent for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: u425868
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance to Highland/Hollywood Mall, El Capitan, Mann's Chinese Theater, Walk of Fame, and other popular sites in Hollywood. Kind of scary at night, but nothing unsafe ever happened. Clean room, comfy beds. Parking lot got full at night, but attendant always allowed me to park by the front. This was around the time the Dodgers were in the playoffs so that may have been the reason for the packed parking lot. Didn't try the breakfast. One night when returning to the room we saw three young people talking about prostitution and the girl immediately reminded the guy "because you know it's illegal to solicit right?" Of course she had to act as if she was innocent, but I'm sure they were trying to agree on a price. Close to Pink's Hot Dogs and In'N'Out Burger. Not very noisy, which is good! If you're on a budget it's an ok place to stay. If you can afford more, you probably should spend a few more bucks for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “OK For What You Pay”
Reviews.Author: Dave_Shep
Reviews.Content: We were touring California by car and noticed this hotel opposite one we had already booked into. We had been using Comfort Inns previously beacause of the price and though not laways the cleanest hotesl the rooms supplied more that a lot of more expensive ones - an iron, 4 towels, microwave and safe to name a few. The Asian girl on the desk was very helpful though the woman on the desk a couple of days later was a bit abrupt. The room was clean, air conditioning worked OK and we didn't have a problem with noise, though I could hear someone walking about upstairs in the morning. We stayed here on 2 separate occasions, on the first the TV didn't work and they knocked something off the room rate. It is excellently located for Hollywood and the Hollywood Bowl and we preferred it to the Hollywood Heights Hotel acros the road because it was cheaper in all aspects. The pool is a joke - more like a plunge bath and I noticed there were quite a few dead insects at the bottom of it which put me off. The free breakfast at Comfort Inns is a bit disappointing - everything is sickly sweet and we tended to eat out most of the time. The lad in charge of the breakfast had poor English and didn't understand what I was asking for.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely, utterly awful...”
Reviews.Author: Pezala
Reviews.Content: Booked one night through Amex for what seemed like a good price for the location. But what a very false economy this proved to be!! After checking in initially with a receptionist who I found surly and abrupt, I went to the room I had been allocated and was confronted with a bizarre sight. Dirty bed sheets were piled up in one corner. There were no pillows. And the mattress for the bed was propped up in another corner. I returned to the reception desk to complain. The receptionist gave me a replacement room, but not before she entertained me by making a viciously angry and abusive phone call to a colleague in front of me! Parking was cheap ($4 per day) - although there was no prior notification of the parking charges and they led me to believe that it would be free. The swimming pool was laughably small - I figure they must have had it installed as cheaply as possible simply so that they could advertise the fact that they have a swimming pool. And parked in the car park was a vehicle from a local pest control service - if I had noticed it at the time this would have been an ominous portent of what was to come! As the walls between adjacent rooms are almost paper-thin, I was woken in the night at 2AM by people in a neighbouring room. And I was then woken again, strangely, by someone randomly banging on room doors at 3AM. Quite possibly this someone had come straight off the street - the door from the car park had been propped open and so, with no security, the corridors of the hotel were accessible by anyone from the street! This experience was then capped off by an unpleasant attack of bedbugs, which, as I now in hindsight see from the other reviews on this website, no stay at this hotel would be complete without. I complained in the morning to the manager, who I found to have a discourteous and somewhat aggressive demeanour. Basil Fawlty-like, he started ranting about people like me who book online, get a discounted room rate, and how he would have to put a stop to this discounting as they would go out of business if everyone else had the audacity to get accommodation at such cheap rates!!

Reviews.Title: “It served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: kjnielsen206
Reviews.Content: I booked this stay through American Express to use up some reward points so this ended up costing me a total of $70 for two nights. I cannot really complain. I did see any bugs nor I have been bitten. I was on the street side of the hotel so there is a low roar going on constantly. The rug needs a good cleaning, I was go barefoot inside and when I stepped into the shower, the water from my was black. Aside from that, the room is okay. I almost travel for the ambiance of the room, there are too many other things to consider.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok; plus a bug problem”
Reviews.Author: mustangpony
Reviews.Content: I got a really good deal for this hotel, which is in Hollywood and pretty much within walking distance of Hollywood Blvd. The beds were ok, but not as comfortable as Holiday Inn's. Just as some other reviewers stated, I too had a bug problem in my room, so beware. The staff wasn't rude, but not too friendly either. So unless you're really trying to budget and don't mind sharing the room with a few 6-8 legged friends, avoid this place.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs! Beware! Beware!”
Reviews.Author: BillSmith25
Reviews.Content: I wish we had seen this site prior to staying at this hotel. We are incurring lots of expense after staying at this hotel and bringing bed bugs back with us. We called the manager who admitted to an infestation in at least one room on the third floor, he then claimed there wasn't a problem and competitors were writing bad reviews which weren't true. In our opinion there was a big problem during our stay (which was not on the third floor) and the management simply does not care or want to hear about it which most likely speaks to this problem continuing on and other unfortunate travelers being affected negatively. We asked to get the name and number of the owner of the hotel. The manager stated he did not have time to deal with our concerns and hung up on us. Our stay will cost us several thousand in expenses, lots of time and the bites are very uncomfortable. If someone hears of a class action lawsuit please post. It seems very unfair that guests suffer a costly injury from staying at a hotel and then are left to pay for the aftermath of what appears to be poorly managed operation. Shouldn't there be some disclosure requirements? Hotel: Comfort Inn, Hollywood 2010 N. Highland Ave

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: cipherdaz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this place because of location and price. Day Parking charge was very reasonable for the area (much cheaper than Holiday Inn across the road). Rooms were very nice (better than pictured) and breakfast quite good also. Mel's diner only 2 blocks away for something more substantial. I found the rooms quite big and a/c did a good job. To be honest, the place is a little run down and had a few issues with key-card swipes needing replacement and main hallways very hot. Other than that I don't have anything bad to say about it. From the recent reviews there appears to be mixed experiences so maybe it's now under bad management. Shame, cos was considering this place for another trip in Jan 2008 but maybe I'll look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: frightnight
Reviews.Content: Our daughter stayed at this hotel in May while looking for residence in LA. She recomended it to us becuase she was satisfied with the service and the price. When we visited her in September we booked the hotel for a three night stay. At 4:30 am the next morning, my husband got up to go to the bathroom. when he pulled the spread back to get back into the bed, bugs were all in the bed, BED BUGS. At first we didn't know what kind of bugs they were, then my husband got a tissue and smashed one; it was full of blood. He said, oh my God these are bed bugs. We packed up our luggage, went downstairs and immediately asked for another room. They moved us to the third floor which was much cleaner but smelled horrible. After my insistance, at checkout, they comped us for one night and gave us 50% off of the other two nights. So my stay for 3 nights was $101 total with tax, which is what it should be for such a filthy place. The contenintal breakfast was the only thing worth the $100. I asked to see the manager 5 times, he never called my room or cell phone and never tried to reach us at all; very unprofessional. I would not recommend this place to anyone. We had to clean our suitcases and wash all of our clothes at a laundry mat before bringing them into our home for fear of transporting those parasites in our own home. A very inconvenient and buggy experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in WeHo, clean rooms, no problems”
Reviews.Author: 2K's
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on the Comfort Inn website because my husband and I were going to a concert at the Hollywood Bowl and wanted to be within walking distance. I started to worry when I read the recent reviews of this hotel so I called the 800# on my reservation and was told that that hotel is no longer a Comfort Inn. They told me to call hotel directly so I did. The new management had my reservation information and assured me my room would be ready when I arrived the next day. We booked a King Suite and were very pleased with the size of the room and how clean everything was - no sign of bugs anywhere (and I looked, believe me!!) The bed was comfy and there was a loveseat in the room, a mini-fridge, microwave and bathroom with separate sink/vanity area. Parking is only $6/day which is very reasonable for the area. All other hotels including Best Western and Holiday Inn across the street charge $25/day. You can walk to Hollywood Blvd and The Walk of Fame where all the famous people have their "stars". The Hollywood & Highland complex is 2 blocks away and has great shopping and food options. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting West Hollywood and looking for a good deal at a decent place.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great!”
Reviews.Author: Lichty
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Comfort Inn Hollywood - great location for tourists only one or two block walk to the main attractions. Found the hotel to be pricey - $160 for one night for two adults - they did not charge for parking which I was told they usually do at a rate of $25 per day. Pool was very small and murky - I would not even consider swimming in it. Room was very nicely decorated - bed comfortable and it seemed to be clean until we woke up in the morning and found a "bunch" or small ants all over us and on the pillows. Upon pulling down the bed sheets we could see a lot of these little critters crawling all over the mattress we even found them on the coffee pot and vanity sink. The free breakfast was half decent and filled us up. I would not stay at this hotel again due to the bugs and price. Preplan your holiday and book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMom43
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Comfort Inn & Suites on Highland Avenue in Hollywood despite what I had read in previous reviews of this hotel. I'm so glad I did not listen to those reviews. I have stayed many times in Hollywood and found this Comfort Inn to be the best deal (if you book early). The rates on all Hollywood hotels are high even for the worst of hotels, so it is rare to get a reservation (under $100) at a hotel that offers clean rooms, great service and security. We booked a room with two queen beds, it had a refrigerator, microwave, iron & ironing board, hairdryer and also came with a in-room coffee maker. The room was just like the picture (on their website). Our room was very spacious and clean, no bed bugs (as stated in previous reviews), it had above-average decor and amenities. We found extra pillows in the dresser and had plenty of soft clean towels as well. The hotel staff was friendly and courteous both day and night. The only drawbacks to this hotel were street access, it's on a very busy street with 6-lanes and no middle turn lane, so it was impossible to cut across to drive into the parking area coming back from Universal Studios. We did have to pay $6 extra for a hotel parking fee, but with the limited amount of parking available in Hollywood I felt it was worth having my car in a covered garage secured with a parking attendant. I did not have to leave my car keys with the attendant either (as stated in some previous reviews). Also the pool was somewhat small, but if all you need is a clean comfortable place to sleep it was great. What I really liked most was the comfortable beds, the shutters on the windows, the fact that our room was very quiet despite the busy street (our room was on the 3rd floor) and the excellent location (2 mi. from Universal Studios, 2 blocks from the Kodak Theatre (walking distance) and to all the other popular tourist spots on Hollywood Boulevard. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Watch Out”
Reviews.Author: spotsandfriday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights while introducing out-of-town guests to Hollywood and Los Angeles. This was not a good deal for the price (we paid extra to have a "suite" which is not a suite at all but a regular hotel room plus a small sofa bed). Our toilet clogged the first morning. When I went to the front desk to tell them, they scurried about looking for the plunger because they had loaned it to another room. Apparently clogged toilets are a common feature here. Then, when they found the plunger, they delivered it to our room...AND LEFT! They expected us to unclog the toilet. They came back an hour later to retrieve the plunger. We paid $6 per day for parking. The problem is that they sell parking spaces to the Hollywood Bowl patrons, too. One night when we came back, we were asked to park our large van in a compact space between a wall and a large SUV. This was a challenge when we had just a few inches clearance! When we complained, they denied they sold parking to others, but there is a sign right at the entrance that says "Hollywood Bowl Parking $25". The hallway ceiling outside our room had some major leaks. They had four buckets in the hallway to catch the water. Throughout the weekend, the air conditioner in the hallway was off, so it was hot, muggy, and smelly in the hallway. The hotel advertises wireless internet, but I couldn't get my laptop to connect. When I inquired at the front desk, I was told the wireless service was only available in the tiny lobby next to the front desk. Rather than deal with that, I ended up connecting to the Best Western wireless service across the street. The pool is the smallest hotel pool I've ever seen and it is not heated. It is sandwiched between the elevator and the buildings with no room or sun to lay out. The continental breakfast is okay - cereal, toast, doughnuts, bagels, fruit juice. Watch out for the vending machines - I spent $2 on a bottled water that never came out. Our bathroom sink was slow and backed up while we brushed our teeth or shaved. But we didn't want to complain because we had already been to the front desk too many times and feared repercussions while away from our room. This hotel is in a good area if you want to walk to the sights on Hollywood Boulevard (it's about a half mile walk). But the sidewalks are not well-maintained, so be careful. There is a mini-market and Starbucks one building over from the hotel that is convenient. During most of the day and evening, it is near impossible to make a left-hand turn out of the parking lot, so plan accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious”
Reviews.Author: t0moko
Reviews.Content: A true hole. We booked this place on short notice after finding our previous hotel lacking, and being unable to find anyting else suitable within our price range. The first night my family and I stayed in one of their "suites," room 201, where the second room contained no furniture except an oddly placed and tiny pull-out love seat, and was connected to the first room by a door with no doorknobs (creepy). The main bedroom was better equipped, but featured dirty carpets, a hole in one wall, bare flourescent tube light fixtures, and a missing print over one bed. One of my family members was extrememly perturbed by the "negative energy" in this room and had disturbing nightmares all that night, to the point that she refused to stay there a second night. Aterwards we asked to be changed to two double rooms, which were adequate, but still the worse for wear. Fortunately, there were no encounters with bed bugs (something that seems to have been a problem for many other guests) but I would caution all travelers to steer clear of this place.

Reviews.Title: “No upper Management to resolve customer issues”
Reviews.Author: wmn2wmn
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel Dec. 3, and checked out Dec 4. Once I returned home to Arizona, I realized I forgot values in my hotel room. I called and spoke to hotel employees who informed me that I would need to have someone come pick them up. I did this, and paid $60.00 to have it shipped to the state for which I live. Upon its arrival I was shocked and dissappointed to find that they had given items belonging to the hotel; pillows and a blankets. When I attempted to contact a hotel manager or anyone in charge, I was told for five days straight that the manager was not on property. I asked what would staff do if there were an emergancy, or in need of a manager. I was told, they would have to wait until the manager showed up. I am very dissappointed and will most likely stir clear of this particular hotel in my future travels to California... I suggest anyone reading this, do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bed Bugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: BedbugBeware
Reviews.Content: We thought upon entering the hotel that it was fairly nice. On the 2nd day I was starting to notice red, itchy bites. By the 3rd night I was sick as a dog. I went to the doctor and I had had a severe allergic reaction to bed bugs. I did not even know they existed. The person that was staying with me had a delayed reaction a few days after and had to go to the doctor as well. Now we are suffering even after a couple of weeks after taking medication. We saw 2 bugs while there but thought they were either roaches or a tick. Do not stay here!! The public should be made aware of this!! Bed bugs are the worst!!

Reviews.Title: “Bugged Out”
Reviews.Author: swanalin
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Hollywood, Ca Comfort Inn on North Highland Avenue. My one stay can be summed up in one word, ' bugged.' I retired late after returning from a concert at the Hollywood Bowl and was awaken by itching on my arms. A search of the bedsheets revealed a crawling bed bug. I called the front desk and was given a room change. The second room proved no better than the first. You guessed it, another, larger, bed bug. The only reason I did not check out immediately was that it was the middle of the night. Suffice it to say that I did not get any sleep. I informed the desk clerk that I would not be paying for the ' service' and I was told that the hotel would not charge me the night. Upon check out I attempted to discuss my experience and find out if there was a history of similar complaints, the clerk's reply was 'I made a note of it, and we did not charge you for the room.' I plan to make a formal complaint to Choice Hotels, Inc. Comfort Inn's parent company, and other appropriate agencies.

Reviews.Title: “Terror in Hollywood!!!”
Reviews.Author: lebrona
Reviews.Content: This had to be practically my family's worst hotel experience out of 100's of nights throughout the years in a hotel. We first arrived at the hotel on our stay of seven nights only to find that the electricity was out in the area. According to a lady who was checking out as we were arriving, this had been the second straight day of this. Hotels right down the street were okay and their electricity was still on. The girl at the front desk said she anticipated things would be okay shortly so we decided to park our vehicle and walk down to Hollywood which was only 5 or 6 blocks away from the hotel and grab something to eat. We figured we'd call back later to see if it was on yet. We ate and during this time I called a couple of hotels out of the area to see if they had rooms which they did. We were simply using this as an "if needed" possibility at this point. We felt good once we called back to the Comfort Inn & Suites and the girl at the front desk said the electricity was back on and all was well. We began our walk back to the hotel and it was just about dusk. As we began our walk back, things just didn't feel safe the farther we got from Hollywood -- now again we are only talking a few blocks here. There were rough looking kids and adults hanging out on the street corners and if front of the stores on the way to the hotel. My family just didn't feel safe as we were walking back to say the least. Once we got back the girl at the front desk did not have a computer to show her what room to put us in. She had a written list that she was using to go by. We received a room key and proceeded to get our luggage out and put on a cart to go up the elevator. As we got to our room we put the key card in and opened the door only to find out that this room was already occupied!!! There was luggage and clothes all over the place and the beds were unmade. The occupants of this room were not present. However, if this could happen to them why would we be immune from something like this occuring to us. Fortunately, for the people whose room this was we are honest and forth-right people so we didn't even think about doing anything other than shutting the door and going back to take the keys to the front desk. You talk about a shock this was it. As my husband went down to the front desk to get another room, a gentlemen whose family was staying across the hall said he would stay with me and my daughter because it wasn't safe for a woman and a child to be out in the hallway alone at this time of night. My husband decided on the way down to call the hotel we had inquired about while we were waiting for the electricity to come back on. He went ahead and complained to the girl at the front desk and she really didn't know what room she had available anyway. He told her that if she would just cancel our reservation it would be in everybody's best interests as she was very frustrated that she couldn't come up with a room for us. The only good thing about this hotel is that our reservation ended up being cancelled and we didn't have to pay for ANY nights at this "DUMP". Bad location, hole of a pool, poor elevator, -- just an experience I don't want to encounter again for a long, long time. Think long and hard about staying here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel and I agree to all the other submissions I have seen here. In my room the carpet was stained, the closet had not door and they were housing an additional TV in the room. I HAD TWO TVS NEXT TO EACH OTHER!!!! One didn't even work. The bedroom window was broken and here come the worst, we all got bed bug bites. We had red spots over our bodies that were itchy. After seeing a doctor, we were told they were bed bugs and that we woud have to wash nearly everything we have touched. All we got was a one day free from our trip. Bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Must be bulldozed!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? Just horrible, may be the best way to describe this smelly hole. I simply cannot believe that Comfort Inn’s allows this place to operate under its name. The swimming pool is nothing more than a 5’ x 5’ hole in the ground, the elevators are about 30 yrs old, the room smells like a tannery, the staff are rude, the alleyway to the rooms seems unsafe, the safe was permanently locked, the bed was uncomfortable, the carpet was dirty and the chair has seen better days. Next time I will spend the extra $20 a night and stay at the Holiday Inn across the street. Oh yeah, and if you plan on staying here even after reading my review just remember to come back to your motel room early in the evening since the parking lot fills up quickly and they could not care less about you. They allow non guests to park in their lot without leaving enough spaces for their paying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tonym6969
Reviews.Content: Asked for a non smoking room and received a room that said no smoking outside the door but smelled like a urinal. I asked for a different room and got the exact same smell. Do all the rooms in this hotel stink? I heard loud noises from above but my complaints to the hotel clerk fell on death ears. The couple staying next to me also complained about the noises to no avail. The safe did not work, the carpet needed cleaning and the chair looked like it was dragged in from Hollywood blvd. On the positive side they have a phone in the washroom, next to the bed and on the desk. This enables you to make phone calls from three different locations while suffocating from the stench. The washroom was clean and room service did seem to do as much as they could to clean the place a little. Take my advice and stay somewhere else. Yes, it is in a great location but I would rather walk for 10 miles than stay in this place again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two days. The place is nice, quiet and safe. The girl at the desk was helpful. The free breakfast is good. The bed and bathroom are very clean. The carpet needs to be replaced: there are stains that cannot be removed by conventional cleaning. For the price and location the hotel is unbeatable. I definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was appalled by the conditions. The room was not clean and I felt this hotel was not safe to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: jerrywright
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The room was comfortable and within walking distance (10 minutes) to the Kodak Theatre and the Hollywood Walk of Fame. Despite the proximity to Hollywood Blvd. and Sunset Blvd., I never felt unsafe…even at 9pm on a Friday night. The location is also convenient for driving, which is inevitable in SoCal. The location of this hotel made our trips to Universal Studios, Warner Bros. Studios, NBC Studios, the clubs in West Hollywood, Santa Monica, and Beverly Hills pretty easy. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was quite good. Our room was clean and the parking garage was very convenient. My only real criticisms are that the pool is very small (maybe 10ft X 20 ft) and the vending machines were always empty. Though this is not a luxury hotel, it is a nice, clean, and affordable place to sleep after your long days in the warm California sun. I felt like this hotel was a good value and would I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “"I Bury Those Cockroaches"”
Reviews.Author: mstarr
Reviews.Content: Ahh, Hollywood. Swimming pools, movie stars and GULP, cockroaches?! Before I get into this review, let me take the blame for having to stay in this hotel. I should have prepared for my trip but, but alas, I am stuck here (as I write this) in a room that smells like their could possibly be a dead skunk under the bed. But I ain't lookin'. Not for the fear of the possible skunk, but I think their might be some sort of bugs and cockroaches player's ball going on under there. I think they are discussing how to eat me. This is not my first stay at the Comfort Inn Hollywood, but be assured it is my last. The first time seemed like a charm, but in retrospect, it was the experience I had OUTSIDE of the hotel that was charming. On this second stay here, words cannot describe how unpleasant this place-- (Hold on a sec. I bought some Lysol disinfectant that I need to spray immediately.) So, anyway, I had a coupon for this place, but it was not accepted. That sucks, but the other places around here don't have rooms available, so, I pay the regular price. Plus parking (they didn't charge for parking last time I was here!). So, I come up to my room, room 202 if you're reading this Comfort Inn folks, and I walk down the hall immediately greeted by guys I thought I was gonna have to fight. It was like an old west showdown, with me being Gene Wilder but drunk off lack of sleep, not booze. I'm just out here for a meeting or two, now I might have to get into some gangsta-ish? Happily, this ain't the movies so there was no static. But then, I open the door to room 202... It smelled like roadkill wrapped in terrycloth. But at this point, having only slept from 3am - 4am central, and it's 1:00 pacific (you do the math, I'm still too sleepy) and not to mention, starving, I hope cracking the window would get rid of this repugnant scent. It didn't. And no time to complain, I have a meeting soon. By the time I get back, I think I could have slept in a refinery I'm so tired. I wake up, crack the window then head down to the "free" breakfast. As I'm eating my donut (which was pretty good!) and drinking my OJ I glance around the room. And their they were. BIG FRIGGIN' ROGER CORMAN MOVIE ROACHES! I'm a nice dude, so I go to the front desk and say, you know, there are roaches in your breakfast area. And, I kid you not, the woman shrugged all apathetic like "So?" Then I said "You don't care that you have roaches crawling around were people eat?" Her reply "I'll let maintenace know." You ever have a friend where you say "I'll talk to you later" but you're not really going to be talking to them later? That's how she said it. My recommedation: If you enjoy repugnant scents and cockroaches for breakfast, please, stay at the Comfort Inn in Hollywood. (Picture to be added later)

Reviews.Title: “Hated It, Lied to about handicapped room being available, in a wheelchair”
Reviews.Author: ArleneSanJose_CA_
Reviews.Content: Booked this room four months in advance, upon arrival found no wheelchair accessible room available! Staff unapologetic, said the lady that booked my room had only been there two months and there was nothing they could do. I asked to speak to Mgr. they said not availabe until next day. Bathroom dirty, they gave us towels and we had to clean bathroom ourselves, had been used and prior guests wet dirty towels still on the floor! Bed unmade, had been slept in. We checked out next day, had two handicapped children with us after driving for 7 hours to hotel. Very unprofessional! Will never stay at any Comfort Inn ever again!

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Anki77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights mid October 2005. I found it to be good value for the price. We had no problems at all. Our room was spacious with a king bed and was clean. It was very quiet (wouldn't know that you were on a main road). Excellent location for Chinese theatre, walk of fame, hollywood/highland centre - no more than 5 min walk. Hired a car for 3 of the days that we were there (really need a car in LA as everything is so spread out) and was able to get a park every night without a problem ($6/night). Was unable to get breakfast in the breakfast room one morning (only has about 6 or 8 tables which were all taken) but that did not phase us as we just got breakfast down the street instead. Best to get there earlier in the morning (prob before 8am) otherwise you might have to wait for a table. The pool is miniscule (as all the reviews say) and we did not see anybody use it but we weren't there to swim anyway. Overall I was very happy with the accommodation and the price was fantastic ($105AUD a night plus taxes).

Reviews.Title: “Warning”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place should be condemned - I stayed here just one night and that was one night too many. Requested non-smoking room, put in a room that stunk to the high-heavens of stale smoke - said they had no non-smoking rooms available. Wallpaper was peeling off - room also smelled of wet carpet and a chair so filthy you just don't want to sit in it. Comfort Inn should be ashamed to have this property under their name.

Reviews.Title: “great location and price”
Reviews.Author: jaskev
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It's right off the highway and only a couple of blocks from Highland and Hollywood -Kodak theatre, great restaurants and a short car ride to anywhere else you want to go. Like any hotel there's good, and there's not so good. The good - very reasonable price, great location, large, spotlessly clean rooms, some helpful staff at the front desk. The not so good - breakfast was a box of donuts, some bagels, bread, a few cereals and cream cheese. No plates. The pool is an oversized bathtub in an alleyway that gets the sun only until about 11am. Not that it matters, you wouldn't want to swim there anyways. The elevators are also in the same alley. The alley is part of the hotel but runs next to the parking garage. It's an odd set up to say the least but we always felt safe - even at night. We never had a problem with parking although some reviewers did. There are about 30 spots and one night we did get the last spot at 9pm. I don't know what the hotel does if there aren't any spots left. One last thing, one day our toilet was backing up and the gentleman at the front desk told us there was nothing he could do about it but he would get us a plunger, if we wanted one. Luckily the problem resolved itself but I don't think this guy would have had any idea what to do if there was a real problem - he also gave us wrong directions twice. Other front desk staff was helpful but they only have one person on at a time so if he's there....you are out of luck! All in all, I would stay there again if I was going back to L.A.

Reviews.Title: “The downside to our trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well we had driven down from San Francisco and arrived in Hollywood to book into our hotel that i had booked months before hand. As we go to check in we were advised that the hotel has been over booked, but not to worry, they have secured rooms in another nearby hotel. When they told us this nearby hotel was 2-3 miles out of Hollywood near Universal Studios we werent too impressed. Unfortunately there was the E3 electronics convention on and we had no other options to stay anywhere else as all other hotels were now booked up. We were booked in for 3 nights and they said that the overbooking was only for the first night, but that there would be room on the other 2 nights. So we headed off to the out of town hotel which was by no stretch of the imagination of the same class hotel as we had booked at the Comfort Inn and Suites...... but it was only for 1 night right? Nope...... the following day when i called to book in they said they were still over booked and would be for the 3rd night as well. To add salt to the wounds, as well as being out of town now and having to pay extra for taxis to get around, the new hotel they had put us in charged us the $89 per night rooms that we had booked for the first night, but the second and third nights they said they couldnt do it for that price and said they would have to bump the price up to $109 per night. So my "intended" stay and Comfort Inn and Suites wasnt a very pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “More comforting than most.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: See my review for the Best Western Plaza Inn across the street. I made a quick change on my reservaation from the BW to this hotel at the last moment from reading internet reviews like this one,which was good. Pluses - room not too bad in size, clean, although we got saddled w/a smoking room and it took two days to get most of the smell out thank God for windows that open(!), price ok but search for best prices on the net, continental breakfast which was v. good (donuts, bagels, fresh fruit, generic cereal etc.), quiet enough since you are right on busy Highland Ave, & good location to the sites. Minuses - you have to pay for parking ($6 a nite), and it is very cramped and the covered lot gets full quickly (you have to leave keys w/ the attendant), the swimming pool is LMAO joke (!) it is really a 10' x 10' x 4' deep square that would be better served if it was a hot tub (and this dunk tank is always in the shade). not a good view from the room unless you like alleyways, a little bit over priced on the weekends (but this is LA). A two and a half hotel, which is above avg. for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveGifford
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in March, 2005 and found this to be a decent hotel. It is located very close to Hollywood Blvd and Universal Studios so handy for visiting there. The hotel staff were very helpful and good at organising all our requests for taxis, trips, airport shuttles etc. Rates were reasonable, around $80 per night. The room was decent and pretty clean. The breakfast area was small with a small selection of foods, but ok really. The hotel laundry is no longer available which was a pity. Overall, a good base for visiting northern LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: h20_lover
Reviews.Content: Very nice staff, rooms were very clean, decent price for location, you can walk to Hollywood/Highland. We had a smoking room and I didn't notice the smell as we are not smokers. I liked having to insert your room key to enter the stairs or elevator, just an extra feeling of security. They charge you $6 to park there which seems weird if you are staying there. Other than that, I'd stay there again as long as they keep the rates down.

Reviews.Title: “pretty decent”
Reviews.Author: moofus
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just stayed here over Easter weekend...and the hotel was pretty decent..Excellent value at $85 a night..pretty good location..could walk to many attractions...pretty safe at night..however as with anywhere you need to be aware of your surroundings..as there are "interesting" people walking about at times. The only problem we had was the pop machines on every floor were out of order and not fixed because of Easter weekend...and there is NO guest laundry like their website lists..other than that it was a clean room with a nice breakfast!!!

Reviews.Title: “The room was large and nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Comfort Inn was very near Hollywood Blvd and its sights.The rooms are large and very clean.The staff were very nice.The pool was small.The only problem was the parking. They had their own parking and the rate was $6.00 a night. If you hav a small to mid-size car , you will be fine.But , the parking is a very tight fit. A large car will have a rough time. And I thimk they may run out of spaces at times. Also , trying to enter Highland Blvd, is alittle tricky at times. More so ,if you are trying to cross over into the south bound lanes. Beyond the parking , the place was a good deal.It was just a 1 mintue drive to highway 101

Reviews.Title: “Great service & location, just a few issues...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stay Dates: March 5-8, 2005 The location of this hotel is great. A short walk to Hollywood and Highland where Kodak Theater is. Very close to Hwy 101 and the Hollywood Bowl. The employees that we talked to were friendly and helpful as far as getting information about attractions. We had to call the hotel for directions several times after we arrived at LAX because we kept getting lost. The man at the desk was very helpful and patient. It was a 2 hour trip to the hotel from LAX (we got lost and had bad traffic). Going back to LAX in the early morning took 25 minutes. The room was clean and good-sized. It had a refrigerator and microwave. However, I had called a few days before our arrival to see if they had free high-speed internet. I was assured that they did. Unfortunately, they do not. Another problem was that they never refilled our supply of soap or shampoo during our 4 day stay. With 3 of us in the room, we went through these items quickly. Also, all the vending machines were out of order the entire time we were there. Having the fridge in the room helps because you can pick up something to drink while you are out and about and save it for later. I would definetly suggest bringing your own beverages since I have read other reviews that indicated the vending machines were out of order during their stay. Overall, I would recommed this hotel. The price, location and friendly service make up for the minor problems that we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: davidnew
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights 26-30 January 2005 after receiving suggestions from the TripAdvisor forums. As other people have commented, it all looks new, the rooms are spacious, the windows can be opened to let in fresh air (too rare in most motels), the room I had was away from the road so there was little traffic noise, the staff were friendly and mostly helpful, the booking via the Internet was smooth and trouble-free, the bed was comfortable, a refrigerator and microwave were provided, and 90+ channels of cable TV were provided (although most of the time there was still nothing worth watching :-). There is a free continental breakfast, although I did not partake. The location is very convenient, close to Hollywood Boulevard and the Metro Red Line subway. With a Metro Day pass ($3), you can get almost anywhere on a bus or the subway. I went to Disneyland for the cost of a day pass plus $1 each way, although this can take around two hours, so leave early. As for safety, the hotel requires use of your room key to use the elevator, so corridor access is restricted. Highland Ave is very well lit at night, and there are always lots of cars going by. I did not feel at all threatened walking back to the hotel by myself as late at 11pm. After dark, there were a few homeless people/beggars, but they were mostly targetting people in cars stopped at the traffic lights. Most never spoke to me, and if they did, I shook my head and they went away. The only thing that prevents me from giving this hotel a rating of 5 is that the walls and ceilings are very thin. Conversations and amorous couples in adjacent rooms on some nights were clearly audible. The worst was when, at 4:45am, something started in the room above that sounded like children playing games, jumping up and down on the floor, running around, and turning the TV volume up. This was still going on after 9am. I did ring the front desk at 6am, and they said they would see what they could do. However, it did not stop. The noises from adjacent rooms were not really a problem, and the noisy children are hopefully an isolated event. Overall, I was very impressed, and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, just a short walk to the Hollywood Bowl and Hollywood Blvd. Highway 101 is one minute north. The room was clean and large, though the view was of a condo twenty feet away. Both vending machines in the building were out of order during our three-night stay. Parking was a hassle. Staff was friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast was average. The hotel looked nice inside and out, and I would recommend it to anyone staying in the L.A. area.

Reviews.Title: “Newer Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Comfort Inn and Suites in Hollywood, CA during the All Star Game. The hotel is a fairly new hotel with little signs of wear and tear. The price was great!!! The location was great!!! Parking isn't a problem at all. Well, it wasn't for us. You can walk to the subway and Hollywood Blvd. It's just a block over. Sunset Strip, Hollywood High School, and Mann's Theater are all a couple of blocks away. Universal Studies is a short ride away like 5 minutes. The lobby is small and so is the pool. So if your looking for a hotel with many bells....this is not the one. If your looking for a nice, clean, affordable place in the hollywood area. You have the perfect spot. As a matter of fact. The hotel was blocked during the Oscar's, which is one block over because the cast of Lord of The Ring's leased it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Loz42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good value for money and the location is great for all the attractions in Hollywood. Rooms are very large, clean and well appointed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were deceived by the managers' friend shuttle service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were deceived by the managers´ friend shuttle service at the Hollywood Comfort Inn. When we were checking out, the manager (named Raj) asked us if we were going to call a cab to the airport. When we confirmed that, he told us that he could get us a shuttle for $15 dlls each (we were two people). The manager told us that we should pay to him $5.00 dlls each of us, and that we should pay the rest to the shuttle driver. The shuttle arrived on time, asked us for the rest of the money and then picked another guest from the hotel that is just crossing the street (Hallyday Inn). Later, he told us that his car was failing. He didn't ask our opinion, but he stopped at the cab service in the Renaissance Hotel garage. There he spoke with a guy and told us he had fixed that his friend will take us to the airport on his cab. Without more explanations, he begun to move our luggage to the cab's trunk, and ask us rudely to step down. We moved into the other car, and after 2 or 3 miles, the cab driver told us that we should pay $5.00 dlls each (just the Mexicans, he said) or leave the car. We told him we had arranged the service from the hotel, and that it was already paid in full. He repeated that we should step down, or pay another $5.00 each of us. We paid him, because if we stepped down, we would lose the other $30.00 dlls. TRAVERLERS, BE AWARE OF THE KIND OF SERVICE THAT YOU COULD GET AT THIS PLACE. BEWARE.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Comfort Inn for 5 days. It's a good price, and a good location, but we had a LOT of little problems - bath drains that wouldn't fully close, phones that wouldn't show you you had a message, a front desk that hung up on one caller to our room "because he had attitude", "Suites" that are still just one big room, etc.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 2010 North Highland Avenue, Hollywood, Los Angeles, CA 90068-3239
